meanings.sent1: He will jow the door to open it.
meanings.sent2: She jowed the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef will jow the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to jow the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The giant's footsteps jowed the ground as he walked.

meanings.sent1: The jow on the door startled me.
meanings.sent2: He received a jow on his head during the fight.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected jow on the table made the dishes rattle.
meanings.sent4: The tree branch made a loud jow as it fell to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The jow of the hammer echoed in the empty room.

meanings.definition: The sound of a heavy blow or knock
meanings.sent1: The loud jow woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The jow of the falling tree branch echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The jow of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent4: The jow of the drum reverberated in the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The sudden jow of thunder made everyone jump.
